Site Manager

Vacancy Number: PR-239943

Australia, Brisbane

Fulltime: 40 hrs a week

Experience: 4 years

Closing: December 06, 2024

Apply Now

Introduction

Brunel are proud to partner with our client who are looking to add a Full Time, Permanent Site Manager to their team. This role has opened due to an increase in project load throughout the year and going into 2025.

This client are long standing in the QLD construction industry known for their work delivering complex Commercial and Industrial projects with average values ranging from $10m - $50m.

What are you going to do 

Responsibilities

You will lead and mentor the site team and trade partners, whilst working alongside the CA and Project Manager on mainly Education focused builds.

  • Strategically planning and effectively managing the program.
  • Liaising with clients and stakeholders while maintaining a high service quality.
  • Lead and assist the team both on the tools and/or off the tools to meet project demands and timelines.
  • Mitigating Risks with a solution-based approach.
  • Reporting on Health & Safety, quality, cost control and budget.
  • Meeting Key Performance Objectives of the project.
  • Construction methodology and adherence to policies, procedures, relevant codes and acts for self and the team Sub-contractor management.
  • Coach and mentor your team to deliver high quality outcomes to support the delivery of on time and on budget.
  • Attend and lead site meeting and lead toolbox meetings.

Essential skills and knowledge 

Requirements:

  • QBCC Site Supervisor license (Preferred)
  • 5 - 10+ years experience working as a Site Manager for a Main Contractor Builder or Developer (Required)
  • Exposure managing Commercial Construction Projects from $10m+ (Preferably with experience delivering projects for the Department of Education)
  • Trade qualified
  • Understanding of construction processes, materials, and best practices
  • Leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong problem-solving and decision-making capabilities in fast-paced settings.

Benefits:

  • Paid parental leave.
  • Professional development encouraged specifically when aiming to progress into leadership roles.
  • Internal and external training courses provided and encouraged.
  • Joining an established business with structured processes and procedures in place.
  • Projects set up for success from beginning to end - fully resourced teams, long-serving PM's and CM's and loyal subcontractor base.
  • Competitive salary depending on experience.

What we offer 

About Brunel:

Brunel is a recruitment and flexible workforce solution provider which connects talented people with opportunities throughout Australasia and around the world. We specialise in highly skilled roles across a variety of technical, professional, trades and craft disciplines, pairing candidates with industry-leading projects and organisations on a contract, permanent or secondment basis.

Operating in Australasia since 1997, Brunel has major bases of operation in Perth, Sydney, Brisbane and Port Moresby, which are further backed by the strength and reach of a truly global network spanning over 45 countries, 120 offices and 45 years of successful operation.

Brunel is proud to be equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates.

How to apply:

If you meet the above requirements and would like to be considered for this role, please submit your interest using the 'Apply' button. Applying is quick and easy - just make sure you have the following documents ready to go:

  • Resume
  • Cover Letter (optional)

Do you have questions?

If you have any questions or would like to discuss the details of this role, please contact <your details here>.

Are you the perfect match for this vacancy? Apply in 5 minutes and let's get in touch!

Anything Else?

Shape your future

Are you ready for the next step in your career? Join Brunel’s powerful global network, where passionate, results-driven specialists come together with industry-leading clients. By connecting specialists to pioneering projects, we drive change in many industries, enabling growth and delivering great outcomes. Brunel helps you reach your full potential and empowers you to make an impact within a purpose-driven global company.

Explore your career opportunities!

Our Culture and Values

At Brunel, we are proud of our unique corporate culture, which is shaped and nurtured by the collective efforts of our employees. Our work environment is characterised by an authentic, communicative and inclusive approach to teamwork that fosters an atmosphere of collaboration and creativity. Our values are at the center of everything we do – for our clients, our colleagues and ourselves.

Learn more about our global network of specialists!

Our ESG Commitment

Since 1975, our mission has always been to connect specialists to exciting career opportunities, to support the development of these careers, and to offer fair and equal employment. This has enabled us to create a truly sustainable and durable business model. Having a passion for people and caring deeply for the environment is not only part of Brunel’s DNA but is also reflected in our culture and values. As a global company, we take our social responsibility very seriously.

Join us on our mission!
